data.title: Fix for issue #17114.
data.body: Improves the ability to add placeholder color and font for single line text fields on iOS. History of these changes can be found at https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16915. This PR squashes the previous PR into one commit to keep history clean. @zilongshanren

data.title: EventListenerPhysicsContact event order problem
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: macOS Sierra 10.12.2
- developing environments
   - Xcode version: 8.2 (8C28)



I'm trying to implement jumping for my player with 2d physics. And I try to do it with the physics event listener to check if the player is on the ground or not.

Here is my code: 

```cpp
    EventListenerPhysicsContact* contactListener = EventListenerPhysicsContact::create();
    contactListener->onContactBegin = CC_CALLBACK_1(Player::onContactBegin, this);
    contactListener->onContactSeparate = CC_CALLBACK_1(Player::onContactSeparate, this);
    _eventDispatcher->addEventListenerWithFixedPriority(contactListener, 1);
 ```

```cpp
bool Player::onContactBegin(PhysicsContact& contact) {
    log("onContactBegin %d %d", contact.getShapeA()->getGroup(), contact.getShapeB()->getGroup());
    return true;
}

bool Player::onContactSeparate(PhysicsContact& contact) {
    log("onContactSeparate %d %d", contact.getShapeA()->getGroup(), contact.getShapeB()->getGroup());
    return true;
}
```

The result is:
```
onContactBegin 0 77
onContactBegin 0 77
onContactSeparate 0 77
onContactBegin 0 77
onContactSeparate 0 77
onContactSeparate 0 77
onContactBegin 0 77
onContactSeparate 0 77
onContactBegin 0 77
onContactBegin 0 77
onContactSeparate 0 77
onContactSeparate 0 77
onContactBegin 0 77
```
0 is the player's physics group and 77 the ground's

I tried with graph priority too and the result was the same.
Why the call order is messed up?
Am I doing something wrong?

data.title: globalZOrder relative to parent node
data.body:
Hi,

Is there a reason to why globalZOrder doesn't work like a Z axis integrated to the node to parent transform matrix? Sometimes it gets really annoying to set some children globalZOrder when you doesn't know the structure of the parent node beforehand. 

This feature would make the globalZOrder perfect as it would keep possible to ignore the node hierarchy and also make group translations (z-axis like).

Cheers!

data.title: Spritesheet created with algorithm polygon now works incorrectly
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.14
- devices test on: Mac
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version: v8.1
   - VS version:


All spritesheets with polygon algorithm now works incorrectly. This worked fine in v3.13.

here is an image of spritesheet
https://www.dropbox.com/s/we5qzb8fqmdd0hx/Screen%20Shot%202017-01-05%20at%205.52.16%20PM.png?dl=0

here is its display in game

https://www.dropbox.com/s/x38nger25z6gsvv/Screen%20Shot%202017-01-05%20at%205.51.22%20PM.png?dl=0

you can see in the background the polygons are created incorrectly as if it is taking whole rects of the image.

data.title: English refinements
Setting opacity on an ui::Button doesn't work anymore ?
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14
- devices test on: linux, android
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10e
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

A new project on 3.13.1 is ok, but a new project on 3.14 doesn't set opacity. The code I used in HelloWorldScene.cpp on both projects is this :

```
SpriteFrameCache::getInstance()->addSpriteFramesWithFile("buttons.plist");
auto button = ui::Button::create();
button->loadTextureNormal("buttons/play-big", ui::Widget::TextureResType::PLIST);
button->setPosition(Vec2(visibleSize.width/2 + origin.x, visibleSize.height/2 + origin.y));
button->setOpacity(100);
addChild(button);
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new project
2. Add a spritesheet
3. Create button and set opacity

Screenshot for 3.13.1:
![mygame3131](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1083134/21673798/5bd69f62-d333-11e6-93b2-10d895ee5909.png)

Screenshot for 3.14:
![mygame314](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1083134/21673809/65b7f29c-d333-11e6-965e-8215098da3ba.png)

data.title: Video Player always plays video on top, regardless of z-order.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: iPhone 7P

Video Player always plays a video on top, regardless of z-order. You can test this in cpp-tests.
1. run the default test and play a video.
2. add a Sprite and give it a z-order higher than the video player. Re-run cpp-tests. Notice the Sprite is on top of the video player. Press play. Video then comes to the top.
3. I tried adding a Layer, as a test, to see if it behaves differently. It does not, same result as step 2.

![screen shot 2017-01-04 at 2 09 00 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7491758/21656204/2aaa5576-d28b-11e6-924b-2261d4c18aac.png)

![screen shot 2017-01-04 at 2 09 20 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7491758/21656223/40b522a6-d28b-11e6-835a-5b6244749075.png)
